# 5.0 Docs

## Globalization

- [Use ICU libraries on Windows](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/core/compatibility/globalization/5.0/icu-globalization-api.md): Learn about the globalization breaking change in .NET 5 where ICU libraries are used for globalization functionality instead of NLS on Windows 10.
- [StringInfo and TextElementEnumerator are UAX29-compliant](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/core/compatibility/globalization/5.0/uax29-compliant-grapheme-enumeration.md): Learn about the globalization breaking change in .NET 5 where StringInfo and TextElementEnumerator process grapheme clusters according to the latest version of the Unicode Standard.
- [Unicode category changed for Latin-1 characters](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/core/compatibility/globalization/5.0/unicode-categories-for-latin1-chars.md): Learn about the globalization breaking change in .NET 5 where Char methods now return the correct Unicode category for characters in the Latin-1 range.
- [ListSeparator values changed](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/core/compatibility/globalization/5.0/listseparator-value-change.md): Learn about the .NET 5 breaking change where the default value of TextInfo.ListSeparator was changed between versions 5.0 and 5.0.1.
